siteId.name: siteId
siteId.description: The name given to the basestation by the wireless carrier. The siteId is controlled by the carrier.

siteName.name: siteName
siteName.description: The site name as chosen by the carrier. The name may be derived from the siteId or from the siteCity.

siteInstallDate.name: siteInstallDate
siteInstallDate.description: Date of installation of the basestation.

siteCommissionDate.name: siteCommissionDate
siteCommissionDate.description: Date of completing commissioning of the basestation.

siteOtherInfo.name: siteOtherInfo
siteOtherInfo.description: This field is reserved to store any information that the carrier chooses to use.

sitePostalLocation.name: sitePostalLocation
sitePostalLocation.description: Zip code or postal code (if applicable).

siteLatitude.name: siteLatitude
siteLatitude.description: The site angular distance north or south of the earth's equator, measured in degrees along a meridian.

siteLongitude.name: siteLongitude
siteLongitude.description: The site angular distance on the earth's surface, measured east or west and expressed in degrees.

siteGroundElevation.name: siteGroundElevation
siteGroundElevation.description: The ground elevation of the site, in feet.

siteStructureType.name: siteStructureType
siteStructureType.description: The method by which the antenna is mounted in the field. Possible options include monopole, flagpole, self support, water tank, etc.

siteAntennaConfig.name: siteAntennaConfig
siteAntennaConfig.description: Used to indicate if the basestation antennae are configured as: Sectorized - radiates RF energy in 1,2, or 3 sectors Omni - radiates RF power in all directions Simulcast Low Power - radiates RF energy to each antenna sector by splitting the carrier's signal output after the signal is amplified, thus requiring a single power amplifier Simulcast High Power - radiates the same information to each antenna sector by splitting the carrier's signal output prior to amplification, thus requiring multiple power amplifiers.

siteNumSectors.name: siteNumSectors
siteNumSectors.description: This parameter is used to indicate the number of sectors in the base station. Options are: 0 = omni 1 = one sector 2 = two sectors 3 = three sectors

siteCluster.name: siteCluster
siteCluster.description: For EMS management purposes, the network may be divided into clusters. This field identifies the cluster associated with the basestation.

siteDomain.name: siteDomain
siteDomain.description: The site domain is used with the siteId to form the hostname of the basestation.

secAntName.name: secAntName
secAntName.description: Sector name. For example, alpha, beta, gamme, omni.

secAntMorphology.name: secAntMorphology
secAntMorphology.description: An indication of the RF classification for the coverage area of the sector. Possible values include Rural, Dense Rural, Light Suburban, Suburban, Dense Suburban, Light Urban, Urban, and Dense Urban.

secAntManufacturer.name: secAntManufacturer
secAntManufacturer.description: Name of the manufacturer of the antenna used in this sector.

secAntSharing.name: secAntSharing
secAntSharing.description: Used to indicate and explain if the antenna is shared with other basestations or other technologies.

secAntRxDiv.name: secAntRxDiv
secAntRxDiv.description: Indicates if two antennae are used in order to obtain diversity.

secAntSpatialDiv.name: secAntSpatialDiv
secAntSpatialDiv.description: Indicates if antenna spatial diversity (two antennas physically separated) is used.

secAntPolarDiv.name: secAntPolarDiv
secAntPolarDiv.description: Indicates if antenna polarization diversity is used.

secAntModel.name: secAntModel
secAntModel.description: The model number of the antenna.

secAntCharGain.name: secAntCharGain
secAntCharGain.description: The antenna gain in dBd (a measure of how well the antenna will send or pick up a radio signal compared to a dipole antenna). Valid values are 0 to 100.

secAntCharHorizontalBw.name: secAntCharHorizontalBw
secAntCharHorizontalBw.description: An indication of the RF aperture of the antenna based on the 1/2 power (3dB) point as measured off the main beam in the horizontal plane. This value is used along with sectorAntennaVerticalBw in propagation tools to mask the path-loss and model coverage area. Valid values are 0 to 360.

secAntCharVertcalBw.name: secAntCharVertcalBw
secAntCharVertcalBw.description: An indication of the RF aperture of the antenna based on the 1/2 power (3dB) point as measured off the main beam in the vertical plane. This value is used along with sectorAntennaHorizontalBw in propagation tools to mask the path-loss and model coverage area. Valid values are 0 to 180.

secAntCharRadOnCenter.name: secAntCharRadOnCenter
secAntCharRadOnCenter.description: This is a measurement of the antenna center line mounting height, in feet Above Ground Level (AGL).

secAntCharAzimuth.name: secAntCharAzimuth
secAntCharAzimuth.description: This is a measure of the antenna main-beam orientation with respect to true north in the horizontal plane.

secAntCharMechanicalTilt.name: secAntCharMechanicalTilt
secAntCharMechanicalTilt.description: This is a measure of the physical mounting of the antenna with respect to plumb (vertical). This value indicates values relative to plumb which is assumed to be 0 degrees. Negative values would indicate up-tilt, which is occasionally done to adjust for excessive electrical tilt.

secAntCharElectricalTilt.name: secAntCharElectricalTilt
secAntCharElectricalTilt.description: A measure of the down-tilt designed into the antenna pattern. This is typically measured relative to a point at 90 degrees to a plumb back plane in the main beam of the antenna. These values may be fixed of variable for a given antenna model.

secLnaFilterType.name: secLnaFilterType
secLnaFilterType.description: This parameter indicated the type of filter used in the LNA/Duplexer unit. It can be simplex (receive only, or duplex for transmit and receive).

secLnaTowerTop.name: secLnaTowerTop
secLnaTowerTop.description: Indicates if the LNA is a tower-top mounted type.
